rooms.description: Your ship has arrived at the USB-Port, where files are exchanged via cargo-ships. Some dockworkers are currently working on various tasks around the port. What would you like to do?
rooms.lookAt:
Just looking around the dock, you can see some containers have been labeled and contain different variables. Every container is grouped into a section with other containers based on their name and datatype.

Everything looks fine at first glance, but while you inspect the containers a bit further, you notice that the container with the label: 1 and the container with the label: '1' are grouped into the same section.

rooms.description: You are crossing the South Bridge, the main connection to the mainland. This Bridge is mainly used to deliver data and periphery devices to the mainland.
rooms.lookAt: The bridge is constructed rather sturdy. Beneath the bridge, one can see the Datastream-River

rooms.description: The binary tree Forrest is genuinely one of the most beautiful places one can visit on this island.
rooms.lookAt: The splitting branch structure of the tree looks almost like a complex algorithm created it. At the end of each branch lays a Fruit with a taste of a power of 2. The 2^3 fruit is especially tasty during this time of year.

rooms.description:
The northbridge connects the mainland directly to the CPU and is used to transport high-performance cars, and is usually used in conjunction with the slower southbridge to manage communication between the CPU and the mainland. There are many cars lined up to cross the bridge

To pass the bridge, one needs a ticket; each ticket is represented as a variable.

Reaching the CPU - Central Parking Unit, you can find many cars, trucks, and even some scooters; every car represents a package/application that needs to be processed in the parking unit. After being processed here, every vehicle is driven back to the mainland.
rooms.lookAt:
//TODO Change Placeholder

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet consectetur, adipisicing elit. Veritatis nostrum dolorum tempore laborum dolorem impedit recusandae, sequi voluptate facilis a ducimus hic rem aliquid quidem neque maxime soluta ipsam quia?

rooms.description: At the Parallax Plains, no matter how fast you go, the mountains in the back move at a different speed than the ones in the foreground, creating a beautiful illusion of range while hiking around the plains.

The DMZ, or demilitarized zone, is a bare land that has been used to fight many wars against viruses, malware, trojans, and other malicious software. Over the years of active fighting, the once beautiful and lushes DMZ has been transformed into a barren desert

Although the RAM Farm looks like very little, it is one of the most critical places on the island. RAMs are the most valuable goods here. RAMs or their harvested products power everything here, from the fuel that powers the vehicles to the clothes and food the inhabitants need.
The Hard-Warehouse is a place where unused or old peripheral devices are sorted. It is run and operated by many Turing-Machines.

The door to the Circuit-Dungeon is a massive steel portal, reinforced with heavy bolts and intricate circuitry. Its surface is etched with glowing symbols and pulsating lights, hinting at the technological horrors that lie beyond.
rooms.lookAt: As you look at the door, you can see the faint sparkling of electricity and the movement of machinery. This is no ordinary door - it is a gateway to a world of high-tech wonder and danger.

bugs.name: The Lazy Programmer
bugs.description: Sometimes during production you forget to change the placeholders to actual data

bugs.name: Just not my type
bugs.description: Just using a normal equality check ('==') can lead to some bugs; using the strict equality operator ('===') is advised.

bugs.name: The MIGHTY + operator
bugs.description: The '+' operator can have some bizarre behaviors if you are unfamiliar with its logic. This can be very bothersome if you try to connect a string and a number: For example: '1' + 2 -> 12 but 1 + 2 -> 3

bugs.name: It's been a WHILE()
bugs.description: Sometimes the code can be stuck in a infinty loop, this could block other code execution. Be sure to have a valid exiting condition.

bugs.name: I can't change you
bugs.description: a 'const' variable without initializer is not allowed

bugs.name: Try to escape
bugs.description: If you include quotes in a string, they need to be escaped with a backslash (\\) or they’ll close out the string.
